website_summaries.verdict: An incredibly versatile, soft, and all-natural sand substrate that works just as well to create aquatic environments for turtles and frogs as it does for building desert biomes for lizards and tortoises.
pros: Great for wet or dry terrariums
Fine texture is soothing on a reptile’s skin
cons: It would be convenient if this pricier sandy substrate was available in alternate sizes

customer_reviews.title: Exo Terra Riverbed Sand, 10-Pound
customer_reviews.text: This sand is perfect for axolots. It's very soft and easy to keep clean. Just make sure you rinse it clear before adding it to your tank. It has a fair amount of "dust" that needs to be rinsed away.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Fogel

customer_reviews.title: Have faith give it a little time
customer_reviews.text: I was devastated after I first put this in the tank it took days upon days to settle down now that I have it in there my mud turtle could not be happier. This has settled fine it's weighted down much better and doesn't fly all over the place the tank water cleared it took about a week but it did clear the turtle absolutely loves it and that's what it's all about he constantly covers himself in the mud. There is nothing cuter.
customer_reviews.author: warmdecor

customer_reviews.title: Sand used for turtle aquarium.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sand for my turtle aquarium. I am using it for the nesting platform. It is extremely soft. When I received my bag it was leaking sand all over so I lost a lot of sand. I got a hold of Amazon and they are shipping me out a brand new bag for free and told me to keep what I did receive. Definitely will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Marie Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Hermit Crab Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying hermit crabs before I had a chance to use this for its intended purpose (for my axolotl tank). The hermit crabs love this sand! It holds shape as they burrow through it, very similar to fine, soft beach sand. I wet it thoroughly with salt water, so it also helps maintain the high humidity they need to thrive. The hermit crabs we bought almost immediately buried themselves to molt-- so I'd say the hermit crabs approved!
customer_reviews.author: Quin's Mom!

customer_reviews.title: My hermit crabs LOVE this sand
customer_reviews.text: I was leery when choosing sand because I read that most sand actually harms the crabs by cutting them. This is NATURAL river sand that I've been using in my terrarium for over a year now. I clean out and refresh the sand in my tank every 4 months. My crabs just love it! They tunnel and play in it. I initially spray the sand with warm water (bottled) until the top is moderately wet. That moisture coupled with the Zoo Med ReptiTherm® Under Tank Heater really provide a nice environment. My crabs have molted several times. Just make sure to watch the humidity levels (too high and too low actually cause the crabs pain and sometimes death).
customer_reviews.author: AUTUMN28

customer_reviews.title: This item is a fine sand and is safe in case your turtles decide ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is a fine sand and is safe in case your turtles decide to swallow it. I had turtles that were eating rocks and would find them around as they would spit them out. It will be heavy and I would suggest making sure your tank is properly set up. This sand cracked the bottom of my tank after about 2 months. Also the sand will get stuck in your filter
customer_reviews.author: Bryanna

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: High quality sand, but loose sand everywhere. Packaging needs to be better!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Newell

customer_reviews.title: Great substrate for Uro's
customer_reviews.text: I used to HATE cleaning our cage for our uromastyx lizards because it would kick up a bunch of dust and make me sneeze, however, since we switched to this Riverbed Sand I don't mind at all because there is no dust when we sift through the sand. It also gives me a little more peace of mind because I worried about the dust from our old sand getting into the uro's lungs and getting them sick but since this sand has no dust I do not worry so much. It also has a very nice, natural color, which makes the terrarium look great. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mugglemama

customer_reviews.title: Very murky.
customer_reviews.text: It is very nice looking and easy-ish to work with. The only problems were that it got everywhere (user error) and that it made the water absolutely nasty. It blocked up the filter and has stayed cloudy for hours. Went to get some Accu-clear in hopes it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn G.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: The sand clogged my filter. It was not good. It never settled to the bottom of the tank. It kept getting stirred up by the turtle. After 2 days I had to clean the entire 55 gallon tank. It was a huge mess!!
customer_reviews.author: New mom

customer_reviews.title: best i've used for axolotls
customer_reviews.text: I use exclusively this sand for axolotls. It's very very fine, so when filling a tank pour water onto a plate instead of directly on the sand to keep it clear. Plants have been very happy in it, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks nice but the spider I had in it after digging ...
customer_reviews.text: looks nice but the spider I had in it after digging some holes and eating some crickets promptly died after adding this sooooooo, who knows. :(
customer_reviews.author: Forced March

customer_reviews.title: Muddy water
customer_reviews.text: Turtles seem to like it, makes the water pretty dirty though.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Harrison

customer_reviews.title: They seem to like it fine and it's nice to
customer_reviews.text: I use this as substrate in my aquarium with Sulawesi Rabbit Snails. They seem to like it fine and it's nice to watch them dig around in it.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Dunevent

customer_reviews.title: but once you get it clean it's good. Super fine
customer_reviews.text: It's probably the dustiest sand I've seen, but once you get it clean it's good. Super fine, great for fish that require fine sand, like cories, loaches, axolotls, any fish that like to bury themselves, etc. Plants are doing well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Creed

customer_reviews.title: My turtle is happy!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sand for my Eastern Spiny Softshell Turtle!!! He loves to bury himself and it acts as an exfoliant for his shedding shell! I recommend this product to anyone with a Softshell turtle.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa Ball

customer_reviews.title: Nice, fine sand
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered about 10 bags of this sand for my turtle tank. It looks great. My Coris make sure tat it stays clean.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Good sand, but be careful.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sand after reading it doubles as desert sand for a terrarium. I've been buying desert sand for hermit crabs for years now, so I assumed this would be okay. Unfortunately, this sand did not suit my needs. It is a very, very fine sand that turns quickly into mud when wet. The sand is of great quality and had no chunks or off colored mixes in it, but if you are buying it for a terrarium that is humid, be careful as it does not take to moisture and water well.
customer_reviews.author: TwoTherapistsAndABaby

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Product is good. Sadly the product bag was cut and it was all over the shipping box when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: clean and very nice-looking. Perfect for either dry landscapes or humid ones, although the sand does cloud up the water quite a bit
customer_reviews.author: Rikudo_Sannin

customer_reviews.title: Turtle sand
customer_reviews.text: Turtles love the sand! They were very happy after I placed them in their sand!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hilley

customer_reviews.title: Gonna buy more!
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to find sand that is fine enough for my pancake turtle to burrow in without the sharp rocks in it. This is perfect. I am ordering more to put in the bottom of my outside pond for him.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sand made my water not balance out. The harness was way too high for some reason
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Bag came torn and sand spilled all through my living ...
customer_reviews.text: Bag came torn and sand spilled all through my living room carpet :/ only a little bit of sand left
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have an Asian Soft shell turtle, and they LOVE to dig! He is loving his new dirt he can hide himself in. He seems to feel a little more"at home" and is making regular appearances. Thank you for the quick shipping and a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha H.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than beach sand
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and feels great. More like muddy sand. My turtles and Cory catfish love it. Can't wait to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Curt L.

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: got this sand for my turtle tank so that the bottom was not bare. its sand so it gets wet and makes a mess, makes the water cloudy and my turtle was always digging in the sand kicking it around. I have since taken the sand out only because I personally did not like it for my turtle tank. However, if you like sand this was good sand and a good color.
customer_reviews.author: pee wee

customer_reviews.title: great sand bad packing
customer_reviews.text: When some one shipped the sand they put it in with the rest of my order that had fish decoration that busted the bag and spilled half of it in the box all over everything.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille  B. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Nice sand but I was surprised at just how little ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice sand but I was surprised at just how little 10 lbs. is. I was expecting a larger bag but guess sand is just heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Hollister

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 11 bags of this stuff for several reptile set ups after losing a breaded dragon to impaction. The impaction came from the use of a different substrate. This stuff is ultra fine and likely to pass right through the animal if ingested. I'm currently using it with the following animals: agamas, breaded dragons and a mali uroumastyx.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Cutler

product_meta.title: Exo Terra Riverbed Sand, 10-Pound, Brown
product_meta.description: Exo Terra riverbed sand is ideal for many types of aquatic turtles as it is their preferred substrate in the wild. Soft-shell turtles especially prefer the find sand for digging and burrowing. Other types of water and ground-dwelling reptiles, such as frogs and salamanders, will also benefit from riverbed sand because of its soft nature. A rough surface, such as gravel, can easily injure skin tissue. Riverbed sand is very fine and can be easily secreted when ingested, unlike gravel or pebbles which can cause indigestion. Created over time in an African river, riverbed sand is extremely fine and round, making it an ideal and safe substrate for the aqua-terrarium. Natural sand, no added dyes or chemicals. Creates a natural and attractive aquatic environment. Stimulates natural behavior. Available in brown color. Available in 10-pound plastic bag.
feature_bullets: Quality and performance driven products for your pet
Provide a better quality of living for your pet with Exo Terra
